content: TITLE: WordPress Image Block Pattern - After Transformation DESCRIPTION: Example of a properly formatted WordPress image block pattern using template directory URI and translation functions for alt text. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/community-themes/blob/trunk/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: PHP CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: WordPress Image Block Pattern - Before Transformation DESCRIPTION: Example of a WordPress image block pattern before being properly formatted for theme use. Shows default WordPress block markup with hardcoded values. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/community-themes/blob/trunk/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: HTML CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Git Branch for WordPress Theme Development DESCRIPTION: Command to create a new Git branch before starting work on theme changes. This helps organize work and makes it easier to manage changes before submitting a pull request. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/community-themes/blob/trunk/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` git checkout -b your-branch-name ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Committing WordPress Theme Changes to Git DESCRIPTION: Commands to stage all changes and commit them to your branch with a descriptive message. This is part of the workflow for contributing to the community themes repository. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/community-themes/blob/trunk/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` git add . git commit -m "Your commit message" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Pushing WordPress Theme Branch for Pull Request DESCRIPTION: Command to push your local branch to the remote repository, preparing it for a pull request. This is the final step before creating a PR for theme contribution. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/community-themes/blob/trunk/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` git push origin your-branch-name ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Credits in Markdown DESCRIPTION: This Markdown snippet lists the credits for the WordPress Community Themes project, including the main designer and several contributors with their GitHub profiles. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/community-themes/blob/trunk/poetry/CREDITS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Markdown CODE: ``` # CREDITS - Design by [Eder Rengifo](https://github.com/ederrengifo) - [shail-mehta](https://github.com/shail-mehta) - [samtoohey93](https://github.com/samtoohey93) - [thetwopct](https://github.com/thetwopct) - [sandroschutt](https://github.com/sandroschutt) - [anjadeubzer](https://github.com/anjadeubzer) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Formatting Credits in Markdown DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to format credits and acknowledgments using Markdown syntax. It includes a header, a bullet point for the designer, and a list of additional contributors with links to their GitHub profiles. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/community-themes/blob/trunk/darken/CREDITS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Markdown CODE: ``` # CREDITS - Design by [Amit Bajracharya](https://github.com/amitbajracharya) - [bijayyadav](https://github.com/bijayyadav) - [kafleg](https://github.com/kafleg) - [MaggieCabrera](https://github.com/MaggieCabrera) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Markdown Contributor List DESCRIPTION: A formatted list of contributors with links to their GitHub profiles using markdown syntax. SOURCE: https://github.com/wordpress/community-themes/blob/trunk/term/CREDITS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` # CREDITS - [melchoyce](https://github.com/melchoyce) - [MaggieCabrera](https://github.com/MaggieCabrera) - [kafleg](https://github.com/kafleg) - [ktstandout](https://github.com/ktstandout) - [spencerravago](https://github.com/spencerravago) - [celiarozalenm](https://github.com/celiarozalenm) - [liviopv](https://github.com/liviopv) - [mlaetitia](https://github.com/mlaetitia) - [giacomo-secchi](https://github.com/giacomo-secchi) ```
